results.content:
This is for those experienced in Backbone, as you can quickly get lost running the code via Nodejs.  I wasn't familiar with Node so it took me a couple of hours to figure out how to work along with the video.  Sometimes the code needs to access the Node server, other times the client side browsing works.  It's hard to tell which project is used.

This said, I'm learning a lot.  Fortunately I started my Backbone discovery with another course that was awesome with a lot of hand-holding.

results.content: Well it's my third course here passed from A to Z. I've seen worse but I have seen much better ones too. Lack of enthusiasm and energy is disadventage.
results.content_html: Well it's my third course here passed from A to Z. I've seen worse but I have seen much better ones too. Lack of enthusiasm and energy is disadventage.

results.content: Can't get past section 2 because no explanation/tutorial/how-to for the Node.js required. Was not listed as a class req. I tried on my own to install node, start the server and continue to work with the files but there were lots of errors I did not know how to solve. I will come back later once I have a working knowledge of Node.JS... or not.
results.content_html: Can't get past section 2 because no explanation/tutorial/how-to for the Node.js required. Was not listed as a class req. I tried on my own to install node, start the server and continue to work with the files but there were lots of errors I did not know how to solve. I will come back later once I have a working knowledge of Node.JS... or not.

results.content: This is an excellent course by the author. I have taken one of his previous courses and was thoroughly impressed, so was confident in purchasing this course. I actually started with Backbone a while a go, but this great course helped me to get my fundamentals right, and gave me more structure for my own code. The course difficulty derives almost entirely from understanding the value-add of Backbone.js itself- you don't need to set up the server-side code or the layout html.
results.content_html: This is an excellent course by the author. I have taken one of his previous courses and was thoroughly impressed, so was confident in purchasing this course. The course difficulty derives almost entirely from understanding the value-add of Backbone.js itself- you don't need to set up the server-side code or the layout html.

results.content: An excellent Course with good series of lectures in it. Wonderful work by the author / instructer. All section of Backbone js course are useful. Over all great course
results.content_html: An excellent Course with good series of lectures in it. Wonderful work by the author / instructer. All section of Backbone js course are useful. Over all great course

results.content: Starting from lesson 6, the instructor jumps in to editing a file called server.js that he then used to make a node server without explaining anything about this file and the usage of it! I have worked with node before and I was unable to follow through the lesson! what did the file server.js has to do with our backbone practice? and how was he able to list all the books through the address http://localhost/books?? the instructor skips explaining  this critical part of the course and moves fast forward to fully established app that has an http server and a list of sub-addresses! I'm really disappointed in how rapidly the course escalated which left me so deaf in the jam! Please update this course and revisit this area and explain to us in coding what are you doing. the provided code does not help us in learning what you've done as it is already done! we joined here because we want to learn backbone so please help us learn step by step! thank you

results.content: It helped me render a view in Backbone. I was missing the "append" jQuery function call. My own example had "html" called instead and wasn't working.
results.content_html: It helped me render a view in Backbone. I was missing the "append" jQuery function call. My own example had "html" called instead and wasn't working.

results.content: I think it is very clear, starts from the beginning, and is well worth the time and money.
